message.content:
cs.MS, cs.DC, cs.AR, cs.NA, cs.SE

Reasoning: 

- cs.MS (Mathematical Software): The paper discusses the redesign of a software for electronic structure calculations, which involves mathematical algorithms and libraries such as BLAS and LAPACK. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper focuses on porting the code to heterogeneous architectures consisting of multi-core CPUs and coprocessors such as GPUs and Xeon Phis, which requires parallelization and distribution of the workload. 
- cs.AR (Architecture): The paper discusses the performance and scalability of the code on different architectures, which involves analyzing the hardware architecture and optimizing the code accordingly. 
- cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper discusses the computational bottleneck of the legacy code and how it was partially re-engineered to have a modular design that relies on standard building blocks, which involves numerical analysis and optimization. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper discusses the redesign of the legacy code to have a modern design that is portable and scalable, which involves software engineering principles and practices.
